sn56.41:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
sn56.41:4.2: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
sn56.41:4.3: “Once upon a time, mendicants, a certain person left Rājagaha, thinking ‘I’ll speculate about the world.’ They went to the Sumāgadhā lotus pond
sn56.41:4.4: and sat down on the bank speculating about the world.
sn56.41:4.5: Then that person saw an army of four divisions enter a lotus stalk.
sn56.41:4.6: When he saw this he thought:
sn56.41:4.7: ‘I’ve gone mad, really, I’ve lost my mind!
sn56.41:4.8: I’m seeing things that don’t exist in the world.’
sn56.41:5.1: Then that person entered the city and informed a large crowd:
sn56.41:5.2: ‘I’ve gone mad, really, I’ve lost my mind!
sn56.41:5.3: I’m seeing things that don’t exist in the world.’
sn56.41:5.4: ‘But how is it that you’re mad? How have you lost your mind?
sn56.41:5.5: And what have you seen that doesn’t exist in the world?’
sn56.41:5.6: ‘Sirs, I left Rājagaha, thinking “I’ll speculate about the world.” I went to the Sumāgadhā lotus pond
sn56.41:5.7: and sat down on the bank speculating about the world.
sn56.41:5.8: Then I saw an army of four divisions enter a lotus stalk.
sn56.41:5.9: That’s why I’m mad, that’s why I’ve lost my mind.
sn56.41:5.10: And that’s what I’ve seen that doesn’t exist in the world.’
sn56.41:5.11: ‘Well, mister, you’re definitely mad, you’ve definitely lost your mind.
sn56.41:5.12: And you’re seeing things that don’t exist in the world.’
sn56.41:6.1: But what that person saw was in fact real, not unreal.
sn56.41:6.2: Once upon a time, a battle was fought between the gods and the demons.
sn56.41:6.3: In that battle the gods won and the demons lost.
sn56.41:6.4: The defeated and terrified demons entered the demon city through the lotus stalk only to confuse the gods.
sn56.41:7.1: So mendicants, don’t speculate about the world.
sn56.41:7.2: For example: the world is eternal, or not eternal, or finite, or infinite; the soul and the body are the same thing, or they are different things; after death, a Realized One exists, or doesn’t exist, or both exists and doesn’t exist, or neither exists nor doesn’t exist.
sn56.41:7.4: Because those ideas aren’t beneficial or relevant to the fundamentals of the spiritual life. They don’t lead to disillusionment, fading away, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
sn56.41:8.1: When you think something up, you should think: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
sn56.41:8.4: Because those ideas are beneficial and relevant to the fundamentals of the spiritual life. They lead to disillusionment, fading away, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
sn56.41:9.1: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
